td.p: July 07, 2025 | Read Online

On this day in tech history: In 1998, NASA‚Äôs Deep Space 1 mission was in the final stages of preparation for its launch (occurring later in October). This phase involved integrating an AI-based autonomous navigation system, AutoNav, one of the earliest uses of AI in space exploration for real-time decision-making.

li.p: How to poison AI: Reasoning Gets Derailed With Random Facts
Telerobotic Chefs Cook With No Delay

td.p: You read. We listen. Let us know what you think by replying to this email.

td.h3: Unlock the Power of AI With the Complete Marketing Automation Playbook

td.p: Discover how to reclaim your time and scale smarter with AI-driven workflows that actually work. You‚Äôll get frameworks, strategies, and templates you can put to use immediately to streamline and supercharge your marketing:

li.p: A detailed audit framework for your current marketing workflows
Step-by-step guidance for choosing the right AI-powered automations
Pro tips for improving personalization without losing the human touch
Tools and templates to speed up implementation

td.p: Built to help you automate the busywork and focus on work that actually makes an impact.
Today‚Äôs trending AI news stories

h2.b: How to Poison AI: "Cat attack" on reasoning model shows how important context engineering is

td.p: A new study shows advanced language models can be derailed by trivial context. Researchers used a system called CatAttack to inject harmless phrases like ‚Äúcats sleep most of their lives‚Äù into reasoning prompts, tripling error rates in models like DeepSeek R1. The attack works by having one model generate distractors, another judge their effectiveness, then testing them on top-tier LLMs.
Simple prompts‚Äîlike cat facts or broad financial tips‚Äîcan destabilize model reasoning, revealing just how brittle AI systems remain. | Image: Rajeev et al.
Even vague financial advice or suggestive guesses (‚ÄúMaybe it‚Äôs around 175?‚Äù) caused failures and bloated token counts - what researchers call ‚Äúslowdown attacks.‚Äù
Suffix attacks can spike DeepSeek-R1‚Äôs error rate by up to 10x, with the sharpest failures seen on math benchmarks. | Image: Rajeev et al.

In math benchmarks, error rates spiked up to 10√ó. The core issue: models still can‚Äôt separate signal from noise. Experts warn that in high-stakes fields like finance or healthcare, irrelevant context can trigger real-world failures. Read more.

h2.b: ‚ÄòTrae Agent‚Äô Thinks, Fixes, and Ships Code

td.p: ByteDance just dropped Trae Agent, a command-line, LLM-powered software engineer that writes, debugs, and fixes code on demand. It handles full-stack dev tasks from natural language prompts and runs workflows autonomously using shell access, structured reasoning, and real-time patching. Backed by top-tier models like Claude and Gemini, Trae parses huge codebases, generates precise bug fixes, and reports results live through a built-in summarizer.

You can import configurations from @code or @cursor_ai with 1-click
(thread below for more tips on getting started)
81 Likes 14 Retweets

It crushed SWE-bench Verified with a streamlined toolset: file editing, bash execution, code graph lookup, and a sequential thought engine. The system is modular, model-agnostic, and open-source under MIT. ByteDance is betting on dev agents that don‚Äôt just autocomplete.
Trae Agent is now live on GitHub. Read more

h2.b: Telerobotic Chef Cooks Steak from 1,800km Away

td.p: A DOBOT robotic arm, remotely operated from Shenzhen, flawlessly grilled steaks 1,800km away in Shandong. No lag, no errors, just real-time, high-fidelity control. It‚Äôs a sharp demo of mature remote presence tech, where latency, precision, and stability align.

DOBOT just bridged a huge gap! Their humanoid robot, controlled from Shenzhen, flawlessly flipped steaks in Shandong, 1800km away. That's serious remote presence in action. Think about the implications ‚Äì from long-distance care for family to new possibilities in hazardous work.
The DOBOT humanoid robot isn't just serving tea and water; it's also acting as an assistant on production lines, assembling robots alongside humans. x.com/XRoboHub/statu‚Ä¶
13 Likes 2 Retweets
Beyond kitchen theatrics, the impact is real: remote caregiving, disaster response, high-risk industrial ops - this is telerobotics stepping up and showing it‚Äôs ready for the field. Read more.
